messages.title: My Priorities for Royal Sutton Coldfield
messages.content: Regenerate Our Town Centre; Save Our Police Station; Fight for More Devolution

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Town centres across the country are facing challenges from the digital economy. And the Royal Town is not immune. That is why I've been working with the Regeneration Partnership and the Town Council to build a Town centre that we can all be proud of.
I stand firm against the Labour Police & Crime Commissioner's plan to close our police station. Sutton Coldfield needs a full service police station and hub.

The City Council continually lets Sutton down. First, the bin strikes. And now, their outrageous plan to charge for car parking in the Royal Park. In my recent survey, 82% of residents agree with me that we need more devolution. So that Sutton Coldfield Services can be run from our Town Hall. And not from Birmingham.

mentions.tacticalSituation: It's a Conservative majority or a hung parliament. At the end of this election, we'll either get a Conservative majority - or a hung parliament. The Lib Dems have ruled out a coalition with the Conservatives. So a hung parliament means Jeremy Corbyn as Prime Minister. With five long years of gridlock and uncertainty. Corbyn would have to be propped up by the Scottish Nationalists. And they're demanding ANOTHER referendum to break up Britain.
